channel.title: How to convert an int to a float?
channel.description: I try to merge these objects into one, i merged reciprocal and div 64: Replacing inlet_in with param_value doesnt work. Is it because i have to convert an int to an float?

item.title: How to convert an int to a float?
item.dc:creator: @Sputnki Filippo Tamagnini
item.description:
@Sputnki wrote:

Right, you have to declare it as an int, not a float

Read full topic
item.source: How to convert an int to a float?

item.title: How to convert an int to a float?
item.dc:creator: @philoop
item.description:
@philoop wrote:

yes..... what i thought
invalid operands of types 'float' and 'int' to binary 'operator<<'
Iit has to do with conversion.
float to binary.....

C:\Users\Philoop\DOCUME~1\axoloti/build/xpatch.cpp:793:50: error: invalid operands of types 'float' and 'int' to binary 'operator<<'
outlet_out = (int)(281474976710656.f/(inf<>6);

thx 4 ur help sputniki

Read full topic
item.source: How to convert an int to a float?

item.title: How to convert an int to a float?
item.dc:creator: @Sputnki Filippo Tamagnini
item.description:
@Sputnki wrote:

try to do 28.....56.f/(inf<<27) instead of 28.....56.f/inf. Test the object and if it does not work try with different values for the bitshift (try smaller).

If you want a complete explanation of the reason for this you should read this topic (i had almost the same problem) http://community.axoloti.com/t/help-with-division-and-multiplication-of-float-values-solved/1562
Especially the answers from thetechnobear, which is quite complete

Read full topic
